bug.author: stalkermustang
bug.description: Hello! Is there any way to train model across multiple gpus? Using DataParallel (as examples show) i'm get following error: <many CUDA index-errors> File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/pytorch_metric_learning/losses/large_margin_softmax_loss.py", line 64, in get_target_mask mask = torch.zeros(batch_size, self.num_classes).to(embeddings.device) RuntimeError: CUDA error: device-side assert triggered I'm using ArcFace as loss and simple MultiSimilarity miner.

comments.comment:
What version of pytorch and pytorch_metric_learning are you using? Are you able to run this toy example? import torch import torch.nn as nn import torch.nn.functional as F import pytorch_metric_learning from pytorch_metric_learning import losses, miners print(torch.__version__) print(pytorch_metric_learning.__version__)
class Net(nn.Module): def __init__(self): super(Net, self).__init__() self.fc1 = nn.Linear(512, 32) self.fc2 = nn.Linear(32, 2)
def forward(self, x): x = self.fc1(x) x = self.fc2(x) return x
x = torch.randn(32, 512, requires_grad=True).cuda() labels = torch.randint(0,10,(32,)).cuda()
model = torch.nn.DataParallel(Net()).to(torch.device('cuda')) loss_func = losses.ArcFaceLoss(10,2) mining_func = miners.MultiSimilarityMiner()
embeddings = model(x) pairs = mining_func(embeddings,labels) loss = loss_func(embeddings, labels, pairs) print(loss)
pytorch_metric_learning==0.9.89 torch==1.6.0+cu101 brb after try example above on 2 gpus

Code below runs without errors: import torch import torch.nn as nn import torch.nn.functional as F import pytorch_metric_learning from pytorch_metric_learning import losses, miners print(torch.__version__) print(pytorch_metric_learning.__version__)
class Net(nn.Module): def __init__(self): super(Net, self).__init__() self.fc1 = nn.Linear(512, 32) self.fc2 = nn.Linear(32, 2)
def forward(self, x): x = self.fc1(x) x = self.fc2(x) return x
x = torch.randn(32, 512, requires_grad=True).cuda() labels = torch.randint(0,10,(32,)).cuda()
model = torch.nn.DataParallel(Net()).to(torch.device('cuda')) loss_func = losses.ArcFaceLoss( margin=28.6, num_classes=10, embedding_size=2).to(torch.device('cuda')) mining_func = miners.MultiSimilarityMiner(epsilon=0.1)
embeddings = model(x) pairs = mining_func(embeddings,labels) loss = loss_func(embeddings, labels, pairs) print(loss) but in my model get errors. Also i have some custom functions (collate and getter) as below: def collater(batch): """ Flattens all sequences in one large sequence """ batch_size = len(batch) indices = torch.cat([sample[0] for sample in batch]) seq_sizes = [len(sample[0]) for sample in batch] num_words = [len(sample[1]) for sample in batch]
seq_accum_sizes = [seq_sizes[0]] for idx, size in enumerate(seq_sizes[1:]): seq_accum_sizes.append(size + seq_accum_sizes[idx])
seq_accum_sizes += [0] offsets = torch.cat([sample[1] + seq_accum_sizes[idx - 1] for idx, sample in enumerate(batch)]) targets = torch.LongTensor([sample[2] for sample in batch]).reshape( batch_size, 1)
return {'indices': indices, 'offsets': offsets, 'num_words': num_words, 'targets': targets}
def data_and_label_getter(x): return (x['indices'], x['offsets'], x['num_words']), x['targets']
class MyTrainer(trainers.MetricLossOnly): def get_trunk_output(self, data): return self.models["trunk"]( data[0].to(self.data_device), # indexes for bagging data[1].to(self.data_device), # word offsets data[2] # number of words, used for reverse split sentence ) cause i work with texts (and transform into indexes for BaggingEmbedder) i'm note that i run 10 full epochs on one gpu without any erros trunk model forward seems simlpe: def forward(self, indices, offsets, num_words): output = super().forward(indices, offsets)
sequences_emb = [] accum_seq_size = 0 for seq_size in num_words: seq_emb = output[accum_seq_size: accum_seq_size + seq_size, :] sequences_emb.append(self.sequence_fn(seq_emb, axis=0)) accum_seq_size += seq_size
sequences_emb = torch.stack(sequences_emb)
return sequences_emb

device = torch.device("cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
class LanguageModel(nn.Module): def __init__(self): super(LanguageModel, self).__init__() self.emb = nn.Embedding(10000, 300) self.fc1 = nn.Linear(300, 32)
def forward(self, x): x = self.emb(x) x = self.fc1(x) return torch.mean(x, dim=1)
class Embedder(nn.Module): def __init__(self): super(Embedder, self).__init__() self.fc1 = nn.Linear(32, 10)
def forward(self, x): return self.fc1(x)
class RandDataset(torch.utils.data.Dataset): def __init__(self, num_objs, vocab_size, num_classes=2000, sample_len = 10): self.num_objs = num_objs self.vocab_size = vocab_size self.sample_len = sample_len self.num_classes = num_classes
def __len__(self): return self.num_objs
def __getitem__(self, idx): sample = torch.randint(0,self.vocab_size,(self.sample_len,)) label = torch.randint(0,self.num_classes,(1,))[0].item() return sample, label
train_dataset = RandDataset(100_000,10000)
trunk = LanguageModel() trunk_output_size = trunk.fc1.out_features trunk = torch.nn.DataParallel(trunk.to(device))
embedder = torch.nn.DataParallel(Embedder().to(device))
loss_func = losses.ArcFaceLoss( margin=28.6, num_classes=2000, embedding_size=10).to(device) mining_func = miners.MultiSimilarityMiner(epsilon=0.1)
batch_size = 360 num_epochs = 2
trunk_optimizer = torch.optim.SGD(trunk.parameters(), lr=0.0001) embedder_optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(embedder.parameters(), lr=0.001, weight_decay=0.0001)
models = {"trunk": trunk, "embedder": embedder} optimizers = {"trunk_optimizer": trunk_optimizer, "embedder_optimizer": embedder_optimizer} loss_funcs = {"metric_loss": loss_func} mining_funcs = {"tuple_miner": mining_func}
trainer = trainers.MetricLossOnly(models, optimizers, batch_size, loss_funcs, mining_funcs, train_dataset, dataloader_num_workers = 12)
trainer.train(num_epochs=num_epochs)

You can also try using your model in a simple training loop like this (rather than using this library's trainer), and see if you still get an error: ### from https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/blitz/cifar10_tutorial.html#train-the-network for epoch in range(2): # loop over the dataset multiple times
running_loss = 0.0 for i, data in enumerate(trainloader, 0): # get the inputs; data is a list of [inputs, labels] inputs, labels = data
# zero the parameter gradients optimizer.zero_grad()

# print statistics running_loss += loss.item() if i % 2000 == 1999: # print every 2000 mini-batches print('[%d, %5d] loss: %.3f' % (epoch + 1, i + 1, running_loss / 2000)) running_loss = 0.0
print('Finished Training')
